intro: Vallaris ovalis, commonly known as the oval vallaris, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually clustered in umbels and are often brightly colored, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds.
